Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TCardFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCardFormatter
  • public class TCardFormatter
extends Object
    This class implements a set of methods aimed to convert a TCard objects to serialized text strings, in several different formats, that can be used to be stored in files, databases or transferred over networks. Supported format are mainly based on standard text formats, such as comma separated value (CSV) strings, or JSON or XML. See also TFileFormatter, the main user of this class as it stores files cards serialized using methods here implemented.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
    See Also:
    TCard, TFileFormatter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TCardFormatter()
      Constructor for a TCardFormat object, where all other possible parameters are set to their default values.
      TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format)
      Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify just the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings.
      TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format, boolean useJolly)
      Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings and if jollyIndex values must be used or not.
      TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format, boolean useJolly, String csvDelimiter)
      Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings, if jollyIndex values must be used or not, which delimiter to use between numbers (default: ";").
      TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format, boolean useJolly, String csvDelimiter, String textDelimiter)
      This is the most versatile constructor for a TCardFormat object. It allows to specify the format to use to serialize cards in strings, if jollyIndex values must be used or not, which delimiter to use between numbers (default: ";") and which delimiter to use to enclose text fields like card labels (default: """).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      String cardToString​(TCard card)
      Convert a TCard object in a textual representation contained in a string, using the default parameters (format, use of jolly, delimiters) set for this TCardFormat object.
      String cardToString​(TCard card, int cardId, int cardSetId, TCardFormat format, boolean jollyOn)
      Convert a TCard object in a textual representation contained in a string. Several format are supported, see TCardFormat values for further information. If the card is participating in a Tombola game, matched numbers are highlighted using asterisks of, for the jolly number, exclamation marks.
      void changeCardFormat​(TCardFormat format)
      Allows the change of the format chose to initialize this TCardFormatter object, letting it to be reused to serialize cards in different format.
      void changeUseOfJolly​(boolean useJolly)
      Enable or disable the display of symbols (i.e.
      TCardFormat getCardFormat()
      Return the format currently configured fir this TCardFormat object
      String getCsvDelimiter()
      Return the character(s) used to separate (delimit) fields of cards when they are serialized in text strings.
      String getTextDelimiter()
      Return the character(s) used to delimit textual fields within a serialized card (default value is the " character)
      boolean isJollyEnabled()
      Return true if the formatter will print symbols to highlight jolly numbers on cards, false otherwise
      void setCsvDelimiter​(String csvDelimiter)
      Set the character you prefer to use to separate fields (numbers, labels, etc.) within the text strings representing serialized TCard objects. Default value is ";".
      void setTextDelimiter​(String textDelimiter)
      Set the character(s) used to delimit textual fields within a serialized card (default value is the " character)
      TCard stringToCard​(String cardString)
      Convert a string representing a tombola card to a TCard object, trying to auto-detect its format among the CSV, CSV_PLUS, CSV_PACKED and CSV_PACKED_PLUS.
      TCard stringToCard​(String cardString, TCardFormat format)
      Convert a string representing a tombola card (see cardToString(TCard)) into a TCard object, NOT considering information related to a Tombola game (i.e. extracted numbers matched on the card). The TCard object is returned as it has just created by a constructor. The input string must be in the TCardFormat passed as second parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCardFormatter

        public TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format,
                      boolean useJolly,
                      String csvDelimiter,
                      String textDelimiter)
        This is the most versatile constructor for a TCardFormat object. It allows to specify the format to use to serialize cards in strings, if jollyIndex values must be used or not, which delimiter to use between numbers (default: ";") and which delimiter to use to enclose text fields like card labels (default: """).
        Parameters:
        format - a TCardFormat value specifying the format to use when converting a card in a string
        useJolly - true to store in the cards strings the index of the Jolly number, false otherwise
        csvDelimiter - specify the separator character to be inserted between numbers and other fields
        textDelimiter - specifies the character to be used to enclose text fields in the strings.

      • TCardFormatter

        public TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format,
                      boolean useJolly,
                      String csvDelimiter)
        Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings, if jollyIndex values must be used or not, which delimiter to use between numbers (default: ";"). Text fields delimiter is set to its default value (""").
        Parameters:
        format - a TCardFormat value specifying the format to use when converting a card in a string
        useJolly - true to store in the cards strings the index of the Jolly number, false otherwise
        csvDelimiter - specify the separator character to be inserted between numbers and other fields

      • TCardFormatter

        public TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format,
                      boolean useJolly)
        Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings and if jollyIndex values must be used or not. Delimiters to use between numbers and to enclose text fields are set to their default values (";" and """ respectively).
        Parameters:
        format - a TCardFormat value specifying the format to use when converting a card in a string
        useJolly - true to store in the cards strings the index of the Jolly number, false otherwise
        See Also:
        TCardFormatter(TCardFormat, boolean, String, String)

      • TCardFormatter

        public TCardFormatter​(TCardFormat format)
        Constructor for a TCardFormat object, allowing to specify just the format to be used use to serialize cards in strings. All other possible parameters are set to their default values.
        Parameters:
        format - a TCardFormat value specifying the format to use when converting a card in a string
        See Also:
        TCardFormatter(TCardFormat, boolean, String, String)

        Returns:
        the format currently configured fir this TCardFormat object

      • changeCardFormat

        public void changeCardFormat​(TCardFormat format)
        Allows the change of the format chose to initialize this TCardFormatter object, letting it to be reused to serialize cards in different format.
        Parameters:
        format - the new desired format for TCards object serialization

      • isJollyEnabled

        public boolean isJollyEnabled()
        Return true if the formatter will print symbols to highlight jolly numbers on cards, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if the formatter will print symbols to highlight jolly numbers on cards, false otherwise

      • changeUseOfJolly

        public void changeUseOfJolly​(boolean useJolly)
        Enable or disable the display of symbols (i.e. asterisks, exclamation marks) to highlights jolly numbers on cards.
        Parameters:
        useJolly - true to enable the jolly number highlighting, false otherwise

      • getCsvDelimiter

        public String getCsvDelimiter()
        Return the character(s) used to separate (delimit) fields of cards when they are serialized in text strings. The default delimiter is the ";" semicolon character, as in standard comma separated values (CSV) text files.
        Returns:
        the character(s) used to separate (delimit) fields of cards.

      • setCsvDelimiter

        public void setCsvDelimiter​(String csvDelimiter)
        Set the character you prefer to use to separate fields (numbers, labels, etc.) within the text strings representing serialized TCard objects. Default value is ";".
        Parameters:
        csvDelimiter - the character(s) you want to use to separate fields within a serialized card

      • getTextDelimiter

        public String getTextDelimiter()
        Return the character(s) used to delimit textual fields within a serialized card (default value is the " character)
        Returns:
        the character(s) used to delimit textual fields within a serialized card

      • setTextDelimiter

        public void setTextDelimiter​(String textDelimiter)
        Set the character(s) used to delimit textual fields within a serialized card (default value is the " character)
        Parameters:
        textDelimiter - the character(s) used to delimit textual fields

      • cardToString

        public String cardToString​(TCard card)
        Convert a TCard object in a textual representation contained in a string, using the default parameters (format, use of jolly, delimiters) set for this TCardFormat object.
        Parameters:
        card - the TCard object to be serialized in a string
        Returns:
        a string containing the serialized version of the TCard object

      • cardToString

        public String cardToString​(TCard card,
                           int cardId,
                           int cardSetId,
                           TCardFormat format,
                           boolean jollyOn)
        Convert a TCard object in a textual representation contained in a string. Several format are supported, see TCardFormat values for further information. If the card is participating in a Tombola game, matched numbers are highlighted using asterisks of, for the jolly number, exclamation marks.
        Parameters:
        card - the TCard object to be serialized in a string
        cardId - an integer representing the unique id of the card, used mainly for SQL format
        cardSetId - an integer representing the unique id of the card set 'phater' entity, used mainly for SQL format
        format - the format to be used to serialize the string
        jollyOn - true to highlight on the string the jolly number, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a string containing the serialized version of the TCard object
        See Also:
        TCardFormat, stringToCard(String, TCardFormat)

      • stringToCard

        public TCard stringToCard​(String cardString)
        Convert a string representing a tombola card to a TCard object, trying to auto-detect its format among the CSV, CSV_PLUS, CSV_PACKED and CSV_PACKED_PLUS.
        Parameters:
        cardString - the text containing the card serialization to re-convert in a TCard object.
        Returns:
        the TCard object is the text is well-formed, null otherwise

      • stringToCard

        public TCard stringToCard​(String cardString,
                          TCardFormat format)
        Convert a string representing a tombola card (see cardToString(TCard)) into a TCard object, NOT considering information related to a Tombola game (i.e. extracted numbers matched on the card). The TCard object is returned as it has just created by a constructor. The input string must be in the TCardFormat passed as second parameter.
        Parameters:
        cardString - the text containing the card serialization to re-convert in a TCard object.
        format - the format used to serialize the card in the cardString text
        Returns:
        the TCard object is the text is well-formed, null otherwise
